citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility has not developed a written program of veterinary care for the penguins maintained at the facility. The written
program of veterinary care is needed to ensure that the facility understands the expectations of the attending veterinarian
regarding the veterinary care of the regulated animals, affirming that both parties have a clear understanding of their roles
to appropriately manage the species on hand. The facility should ensure that the written program of veterinary care is
available for review during all USDA inspections, with the documented arrangements to include regularly scheduled visits
to the premises of the facility.
Correct by October 16, 2023.

The facility’s contingency plan does not include the required elements to address the needs of the penguins on hand in
the event of an emergency or disaster. An outlined plan is necessary to prepare for unexpected disasters or events, as
well as a detailed strategy to address instructions for, but not limited to: animal evacuation, sheltering-in-place, and
backup provisions for husbandry and food/watering supplies, sanitation, and ventilation. The facility shall develop and
document an appropriate contingency plan available for review upon USDA inspection, ensuring the written contingency
plan includes an outline of the specific tasks required to be carried out in response to the identified
emergencies/disasters.
Correct by October 23, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
